**Chapter 35: External Paths Display Power to Deceive True Nature**
**The Monkey King Steals Heaven’s Treasure and Subdues the Demon**

A disciple of enlightenment says: The two young demons stole heaven’s treasures and became demons, turning the five treasures into five thieves. Sun the Great Sage stole heaven’s treasures and subdued the demons, turning the five thieves into five treasures.

The same heavenly treasures, the same act of theft—yet righteousness and evil are utterly distinct, depending solely on whether one cultivates or does not cultivate.

Gold, wood, water, fire, and earth—these are heaven’s treasures, and they are also humanity’s treasures. Heaven’s nature is humanity’s nature. If one exploits their nature one-sidedly, they mutually deceive and suppress each other: fire sees water as a thief, water sees earth as a thief, earth sees wood as a thief, wood sees metal as a thief, and metal sees fire’s force as a thief.

Each thief is a thief to its own nature, each nature is its own nature—yet they lose their true essence. When their natures are harmonized, they mutually generate: metal generates water, and the true yang within water can generate the yin of metal, while the yin of metal in turn can generate the yang of wood, and thus metal and wood intertwine as treasures.

Wood generates fire, and the true yin within fire can generate the yang of wood, while the yang of wood in turn can generate the yin of water, and thus wood and fire are both at their fullest as treasures.

They intermingle as parent and child, alternating as husband and wife, and together they attain their treasures. This is what is called "concentrating the five phases," reversing cultivation and transformation—just as **Nüwa** refined the five-colored stones to patch the sky.

The five-colored stones are earth. The method of cultivation relies entirely on the essence of earth. Earth has no fixed position, yet it governs the four seasons and embodies the central palace;

Fire, through it, does not flare,
Water, through it, does not overflow,
Metal, through it, endures long,
Wood, through it, does not wither.

Thus, *The Awakening to Reality* says: *"The five phases and four symbols rely entirely on earth."*

Metal, wood, water, and fire reside at the four corners,
And when viewed through earth, they are **external Dao**;
Earth dwells in the central palace,
And when viewed through metal, wood, water, and fire, it is **heart-monkey**.

Those who practice **external Dao** wield power
Are one-sided in their exploitation of nature,
Not the true method of **gold elixir**,
Hence they deceive the true essence.

Those who attain treasures with **heart-monkey**
Collect and harvest their treasures,
Obtain the true Dao of **gold elixir**,
Hence they subdue the evil demons.

Two key phrases, most clearly stated.

Readers who rigidly insist that **heart-monkey** is the human mind,
Or shallowly perceive **external Dao** as mere evil demons,
Fail to grasp their meaning.

The opening poem states: *"One’s original nature is round and bright, the Dao naturally flows through."*
A single phrase revealing the entire truth.

It further says:
*"Pure and turbid, how many times they turn with fate,
The eternal and the void, let them wander east and west."*
Illustrating the five phases’ cyclical transformations and the marvel of generation.

Thus it is said: *"This aligns with the Great Sage Sun’s profound Dao."*

The Great Sage Sun is also called **"Xingzhe Sun"**,
With a name that is ever-shifting—up, down, left, right,
Inverted without end—yet encompassing all phases.

He is the **central palace’s yang**,
For the Dao’s body is indeed such.

The **golden rope** of the previous section is also earth,
Yet it is vague and formless,
While the Great Sage Sun obtained its **pure steel’s true gold**.

Because of this true treasure,
He entered the gourd without dissolving,
For earth can quench flames;

Because of this true treasure,
He then obtained the gourd itself,
For fire meets earth and returns to its form;

Because of this true treasure,
He acquired the **jade purity bottle**,
For water sees earth and unifies in chaos;

Because of this true treasure,
He gained the **banana-leaf fan** and **seven-star sword**,
For metal and wood meet earth and intertwine;

Because of this true treasure,
He reversed the **silver angle** and **gold angle**,
For gold and silver meet earth and return to their roots.

The opening line thus declares:
*"The Great Sage Sun attained the true treasure of the demons."*
Linking past and present,
To show that the golden rope is the **true earth of the receptive female**.

This alchemy’s marvel of inverted control
Is akin to Nüwa’s use of earth to repair heaven.

Heaven is the ultimate yang,
Yet within yang there is true yin,
So Heaven One generates water and descends to nourish;

Earth is the ultimate yin,
Yet within yin there is true yang,
So Earth Two generates fire and ascends to blaze.

The **creative male** and **receptive female** are likewise.

The **Dao Ancestor of Highest Venerability**,
With the yang of the central palace,
Repairs the deficiencies of the creative palace,
And enlightens all ages.

The **"one stalk of immortal vine beneath the Kunlun Mountains’ foot, bearing this jade-red gourd"**
Is the supreme treasure for nurturing the elixir,
And must not be overlooked.

By reasoning, originally there were two—male and female.
Yet the female within the male is false,
While the male within the female is true.

The female cannot contain,
For the false cannot form the elixir;

The male can contain,
For the true can form the elixir.

*"Base upward, mouth downward"*
Is the logic of inverted correspondence.

When the silver angle is contained and shaken,
It is white gold entering the fire palace,
Transforming into one breath—

That is *"Gathered and returned to one place,
Turning into a pool of water."*

The progression now reaches **"King Wen of the Zhou, Confucius, and other sages"**
As the alchemists of old expound this principle,
Revealing its origin.

The silver angle contained within the gourd and transformed
Is not death,
But the demons returning to their true nature—
This is the act of **receiving life**.

Eight Precepts said: *"Do not weep, let your younger brother recite the ‘Receiving Life Sutra.’"*
Not mere idle words.

The method of elixir-making
First forges white gold as the elixir’s seed,
While the **gentle wind** aligns with fire’s rectitude at this moment.

Fire is not ordinary fire,
But the breath of **purple charcoal**—
The five phases’ natural transformations and their arranged operations.

The **Old Demon’s fury in his heart** reveals the timing of fire’s function.

Placing the **jade purity bottle** aside and using the fan and sword instead
Is the **gentle wind shaking the wood**, the **thunder emerging from earth**, and the **rising of the earth’s vigor**.

*"Gazing at the southern homocletic fire of Bing-Ding’s fan,
Only flames erupt from the ground—
Fierce and towering, scorching the sky and searing the earth"*
Marks the advance of the **yang fire**.

The Great Sage Sun avoided the fire,
Entering the **Lotus Flower Cave** to take the **ram-fat jade purity bottle**;
The Old Demon retreated to the **stone table**, drowsy and silent;
The Great Sage Sun quietly extracted the **banana-leaf fan**,
Revealing the retreat of the **yin symbol**.

The brilliance lies in the lines:
*"Causing gold and fire not to meet,
The five phases to disorder and harm the harmonious qi."*

Readers assume the **gold angle** is metal,
And **heart-monkey** is fire,
That metal and fire contend,
A common principle of suppression.

Yet they fail to see:
The **Monkey King hides gold and water**,
The **gold angle sits within wood and fire**;

「Water bears the **qi** of generating gold,
Fire bears the **qi** of generating wood;
Gold and wood share the **qi** of mutual support,
Wood and fire embody the **qi** of *jiéjì* [fulfilled/accomplished].

When gold and water intermingle, and water and fire are reconciled,
If gold and wood do not unite, then gold and fire do not contend,
And the lines—*"The five phases disorder and harm the harmonious qi"*—hold true.

Those who cultivate the **elixir** [丹 *dān*] seek not for gold and fire to contend.
When gold and fire contend, the five phases naturally flourish.
*"The Old Demon, defeated in battle, directly went to the Southwest to suppress the Dragon’s Retreat"*—
Seeking life from the source of my birth, pointing to *"Southwest gains a companion"* [得朋 *dé péng*];
Thus, he gained the aid of **Huli Seven** [狐阿七].

*"Huli Seven united as one, directly coming from the Northeast"*—
Returning to the source from where death comes, pointing to *"Northeast loses a companion"* [丧朋 *sàng péng*];
Thus, he fell to the **cudgel of Zhu Bajie** [猪八戒之钯 *Zhū Bājiè zhī yā*].

With both the **yang fire** and **yin symbol** exhausted,
The **gold angle** [金角 *jīn jué*] naturally returns to its origin.
The Great Sage Sun removed the **ram-fat jade purity bottle**,
Enveloped the Old Demon, and called out, *"Gold angle!"*
In response, it vanished without a trace.

Breath and resonance in harmony, no need for exertion;
*"Recalled the Seven-Star Sword, sweeping away all evil"*—
All were true uses of **earth** [真土 *zhēn tǔ*].

Seizing the moment unexpectedly,
Naturally unfolding the **Heavenly Mechanism** [天机],
Not through force, but the very essence—
This is the true meaning of *"gold and fire contending without harming the harmonious qi."*

The **Highest Venerable** [太上] transformed the **blind man** [瞽者 *gǔ zhě*],
Demanding the return of the five treasures,
And explaining the cause of their theft:
*"Without this, the **true fruit** [正果 *zhèng guǒ*] cannot be attained."*

He said that without seeing these five thieves,
One remains like the **blind man**;
But if one can reclaim these five treasures,
Then the **fruit** [果 *guǒ*] is secured.

Transforming thieves into treasures and enduring hardships,
This is the inevitable path of those who cultivate the **Dao** [修道者 *xiū dào zhě*].
What concern does the **Highest Venerable** have in this?

*"From the gourd and the jade purity bottle, two streams of **celestial qi** [仙气 *xiān qì*] poured forth,
Once again transforming into the two **gold and silver children** [金银二童子 *jīn yín èr tóng zǐ*].*
Returning to its original nature and essence,
All is but one **gold** [一金 *yī jīn*].

This is precisely—
*"Floating and elusive, all return to Tiāntóu Palace [兜率宫],
Free and unbound, ascending straight to Dàluó Heaven [大罗天]."*
The marvelous effect of the **gold elixir** [金丹 *jīn dān*] is such.

Aspiring cultivators must urgently seek the secrets within
The **Lotus Flower Cave** on **Flat-Top Mountain** [平顶山莲花洞].

Yet then—
The treasure of the **gold gourd** [金葫芦 *jīn hú lu*],
Which the **gold angle** [金角 *jīn jué*] governs,
Why did it instead manifest as the **silver angle** [银角]?

The treasure of the **ram-fat jade purity bottle** [玉净瓶 *yù jìng píng*],
Which the **silver angle** governs,
Why did it instead manifest as the **gold angle**?

The **gold** enveloping the **silver**—
True **masculine** [雄 *xióng*] transforming into false **feminine** [雌 *cí*],
A reversal in **elixir cultivation** [结丹 *jié dān*];

The **jade** enveloping the **gold**—
False **feminine** transforming into true **masculine**,
A reversal in **transcendence and rebirth** [脱胎 *tuō tāi*].

Alas!
The **Heavenly Mechanism** [天机] is nearly fully revealed.

The **Lotus Flower Cave** on **Flat-Top Mountain** [平顶山莲花洞]—
I once read Master Matteo Ricci’s *Explanation of the Form of Heaven and Earth* [《天地形说》]: Heaven’s body is a vast circle, and Earth dwells fixed at its center. Above, below, and on all four sides are human figures, their soles facing each other in perfect alignment.

For the **qi** of Heaven is clear and ascends, while the essence of Earth is turbid and descends. All around are Heaven’s dominions, so Earth must naturally rest at the core. The very center of Heaven becomes the very lowest point of Earth—thus all figures stand upright, balanced within.

This elucidates the profound truth of the **Dao/Way** of **Emperor Yao**, **Shun**, and **Xi He** [羲和] onward, a revelation truly surpassing all ages!

Calendrical calculations originate from Earth’s heart, yet through them the **Heavenly Mechanism** [天机] remains unexhausted—all this stems from the **soul’s luminous insight** [心之灵明神悟], does it not? Is this not the **soul’s embrace of Heaven and Earth** beyond measure?

Humans indeed possess the **gold gourd** that contains Heaven and Earth.

**Chapter Thirty-Six**—
The **monkey-heart** [心猿] subdues all entanglements,
Splitting open false paths to reveal the **bright moon** [月明].
**Master Treu-One** [悟一子] said: *The Journey to the West* expounds the **unspoken truths** of the *Yellow River* and *Lo River* [《河》、《洛》], clarifying the **marvelous Dao/Way of inverted yin-yang** [阴阳颠倒之妙道], and pointing to the **true path of cultivation** for all ages.

The earlier text concealed its meaning in veiled metaphors, leaving none unexpressed. Now I reveal the **essential core** of past **immortals and sages** [仙圣], taking the *Awakening to True Reality* [《悟真篇》] as proof, to transmit the **gold elixir’s** [金丹] true essence. This is no mere **Chan School** [禅门] misconception of emptying the **soul’s power** [性] through worship and scriptural pilgrimage!

A **clear mirror** [明镜] stills the waters,
A **radiant moon** [皓月] illuminates the **Chan heart** [禅心].
The ancients and moderns who speak of the **Dao/Way** call this the **sage’s attainment of the Buddha’s path** [圣修佛诣], and here its peak is reached.

Yet the **sage’s** so-called **"Divine"** [神] has depths beyond knowing,
And the **Buddha’s** so-called **"Fruit"** [果] is never truly absent.

「Abandoning the affairs of Laozi, to whom else shall I turn?
The upper section reveals Laozi’s **Five Thieves** [五贼] to subdue the **heart-mind** [心君], which is **Internal Alchemy** [内丹]. In truth, it is the very principle of **External Alchemy** [外丹].

The principle knows no distinction between inner and outer,
Yet the **elixir** [丹] has both inner and outer.
When the inner is established, the outer naturally follows;
When the outer is attained, the inner naturally completes.
Inner and outer, outer and inner—
Inner yet again outer, inner and outer sharing the same source,
Crushed into one seamless whole.

The **work** [功] spans beginning and end,
The beginning founds the end,
The end fulfills the beginning.
Again, the beginning is the beginning and end,
The end is the beginning and end.
Inner and outer, beginning and end—
Reversed and overturned, profound beyond measure,
Unspeakable in words,
The **sage’s** so-called **"Divine"** [神] and the **Buddha’s** so-called **"Fruit"** [果].

At the start of the chapter, the **Master** [师父] spoke fully of Laozi’s affairs,
Though it follows the previous text, it truly sets forth the next intent.
The practitioner says: *“Master, if one only subdues the nature and preserves the Divine, there is no need for further affairs.”*
This is the meaning of **still waters** [止水] and **Chan heart** [禅心].
If one can truly transcend affairs, what need is there for the elixir?
The **Three Treasures** [三藏] hope for long practice to reach the Western Paradise;
The practitioner laughs: *“You haven’t even left the outer gate yet!”*
Saying that by subduing the nature and preserving the Divine, one naturally attains the golden elixir,
This is like hoping for the Western Paradise while yet unstepping through the outer gate—
Hence the saying: *“Do not cling to it; simply let your heart-mind go free and advance forward—
The work will naturally complete itself.”*

“**Freeing the heart-mind**” [放心] means letting go of all attachments,
Yet it is truly the act of gathering the heart-mind without letting it go—
Freeing is the very act of not freeing.

“**Advance forward**” [前进] means that all worldly beings do not advance,
Only by retreating and secretly cultivating does one truly progress—
Retreating is the way to advance.

The work, when truly attained, must first manifest affairs,
Yet when it naturally completes itself, it is not forced.
These words carry deep meaning—
Do not read them as mere encouragement to rush blindly along!

When the **Emperor** [进敕] bestowed the **Precious Forest Monastery** [宝林寺],
The **Elder** [长老] nodded and said: *“Even the **scaled and shelled beings** [鳞甲众生] worship the Buddha,
Yet why would humans not practice the **Dao/Way**?”
He sighed, lamenting that the monastery had only the name of **Precious Forest**,
But lacked its true essence.

The **monk-officials** [僧官] struck the **laymen** [道人] lightly,
As the world does—no cause for surprise.
The practitioner shattered the stone lions,
Transmitting singularly and uniquely,
Startling the crowd and bewildering them.
*“It’s not convenient; you should move them away.”*
This can be seen as **perfect adaptability** [圆便],
Not an invention of Old Monkey—
It follows the method of **stealing the body and rebirth** [夺舍投胎].
*“If you don’t strike them, you’ll carry them in anyway.”*
Once the **stick and shout** [棒喝] has been given,
Though the **monk** [和尚] may turn back,
He remains bound to the **Two Vehicles** [二乘].
“**One bundle of poverty**” [一裹穷]—
A self-made affliction,
Lonely cultivation and rigid sitting,
A bundle of poverty within which no elixir forms,
Dishonoring the **Precious Dharma Jewel Monastery** [法宝珠林].

“**Four-bed platform**” [四张床]—
Master and disciple sharing the same couch,
Three families united,
The **Five Phases** [五行] gathered in harmony,
Only then does the **inexhaustible marvel** [妙赏不尽] appear.

On the **fifteenth day**, **pure yang** [纯阳] prevails,
The **Pre-Heaven Bagua** [先天八卦]—**Qian** [乾] Trigram—**three yang lines** [三阳爻].
The **thirteenth day**, **pure yin** [纯阴] prevails,
The **Kun** [坤] Trigram—**three yin lines** [□卦爻图略].

The **first three days** [初三日],
Kun conceives **one yang** [一阳] at **Geng** [庚] above,
The **Zhen** [震] Trigram—**two yin lines above, one yang line below** [上二阴爻，下一阳爻],
The **fire potency** [火候].
The **eighth day** [初八日],
Kun gives birth to **two yang** [二阳],
The **Dui** [兑] Trigram—**one yin line above, two yang lines below** [上一阴爻，下二阳爻],
The **front crescent** [前弦],
The **medicine and substance** [药物],
The **yang** [阳],
The **first eight** [一八].

The **fifteenth day** [十五日],
**Pure yang** [纯阳],
The **Qian** [乾] Trigram—**three yang lines** [三阳爻].」

On the **sixteenth day**, **Qian** [乾] generates **one yin** at **Shen** [申] above,
The **Xun** [巽] Trigram—**two yang lines above, one yin line below** [上二阳爻，下一阴爻],
The **fire potency** [火候].

On the **twenty-third day**, **Qian** generates **two yin**,
The **Gen** [艮] Trigram—**one yang line above, two yin lines below** [上一阳爻，下二阴爻],
The **rear crescent** [后弦],
The **medicine and substance** [药物],
The **yin** [阴],
The **two eights** [二八].

The *Cántóng* [参同] states:
*"Kàn-Lí* [坎离] are the **two functions of Qian and Kun** [乾坤二用].
Two without fixed positions, circulating through the **six voids** [六虚].
Coming and going are not fixed, above and below have no constancy."
Thus, the Sage adopts these **two eights** [二八],
And from them, **Kàn-Lí** [坎离] arise within—
This is called **"embracing One to contain Three"** [抱一函三].

The **secret verse** [诀] says:
*"Pre-Heaven **One Qi** [先天一气] transforms into **Qian-Kun** [乾坤],
**Gen-Dui** [艮兑] revolve at the **Zhen-Xun** [震巽] gates.
Only the **six voids** [六虚] generate wondrous efficacy,
**Kàn-Lí** [坎离] ebb and flow—**Dao** [道] holds supreme."

This is the **true utterance of the Moon’s brilliance** [月明之真言].
When insight is fully awakened, it is as if **taking the scriptures from the Western Heaven** [西天取经].

The **Sand Monk** further points out:
*"Gold in water"* [水中之金] is the **Five Phases converging** [五行攒簇],
Entirely dependent on **Earth’s correspondence** [全凭土配],
With the **three families united** [三家同会],
Only then does the **Sun’s fullness** [日圆] appear.
*"Water and fire intermingling each have their fate"* [水火相搀各有缘],
Encompassing the **mysteries of *Jìjiè*** [既济], **starting the work** [下手], and **warm nourishment** [温养].

The **Eight Precepts** further clarifies the **subtlety of waxing and waning** [圆缺不全之妙],
Which is the **unfinished secret** [不全之秘要] of *"The Moon emerges on the third day"* [三日月出庚] in *Cántóng*,
And the **true scripture of this very chapter** [本书本回真经].
It also indicates that after the **Moon’s fullness** [月圆],
One must fulfill **three thousand functions** [功满三千] to comply with **Heaven’s edict** [应天诏].

Each disciple expounds upon the **essential nature of cultivation** [本质阐发修炼玄机],
And thus the **entire oral transmission of the Golden Elixir** [金丹始终口诀] is fully revealed.

Yet fearing that one might **recite the *Heart Sutra* in vain** [空念《心经》],
While failing to grasp the **true scripture of Mahayana** [大乘真经],
The **Pilgrim**—through the fault of reciting incorrectly—
Fails to awaken to the **true scripture’s essence** [真经未取晓悟],
This is called **"splitting the side door to see the Moon’s intent"** [劈傍门而见月明意].

*"When the Moon reaches the Heavenly Heart,
The Phoenix comes to the water’s surface,
Such pure delight—
Few truly know its worth."*

The poet who composed this—
Did he understand?

**Thirty-seventh installment**
*The Ghost King Visits Tang Sanzang at Night*
*The Monkey King Transforms as a Child to Lead Away the Infant*

**Treasure One** [悟一子] says:
*"Above, the Moon’s body aligns with Pre-Heaven,
Yet the **wondrous efficacy of Kàn-Lí** [坎离之妙用] remains unseen.
From here onward, it clarifies how **evil masters fail to grasp the Moon’s intent** [月明的旨],
Misidentifying **heart and kidney as Kàn-Lí** [心肾为坎离],
Sealing the **tail-end orifice** [尾闾之穴] in vain,
Taking another’s child as their own,
Thus allowing **evil to occupy *Lí’s* position** [邪乘离位],
While the **true essence falls into *Kàn’s* domain** [真陷坎宫]."

The **case of the Wūjī Kingdom** [乌鸡国一案因果] is recounted to illustrate:
The **mother and child reuniting** [阿母婴儿，母子会合重逢]
Is the **true path of filling *Kàn* with *Lí*** [取坎填离],
The **Golden Elixir entering the mouth** [金丹入口],
The **correct method of reviving the dead** [起死回生之正道].

It must be clarified:
The **main theme—*"The Ghost King Visits the Three Sages"** [鬼谒三藏]—
Reveals that the **cause of falling into error** [失陷之由]
Lies in **mistaking the complete truth** [误认全真];
*"The Spirit Leads Away the Infant"* [神引婴儿]—
Shows that the **method of saving the whole** [救全之法]
Depends on **restoring faith between mother and child** [取信子母].

The **Ghost King** declares:
*"My home lies in the true west,
Known as the **Wūjī Kingdom** [乌鸡国]."*

The **three-legged crow, the black bird of day** [金鸡三足乌],
Is the **yin within the sun’s zenith** [日中之阴],
The **Heart Sovereign** [心君] itself.
When the **Sovereign’s fire rages unchecked** [君火亢炎],
Only **water can temper it** [非水不济].
The **complete truth arrives from the south** [南来全真],
Praying for rain to nourish the land,
And after long drought, rain falls—
**Water and Fire in Harmony** [水火既济],
Illustrating **Qian-Kun’s mutual response** [乾坤交感],
Where **Qian transforms into Kàn** [乾变为坎],
And **Kun transforms into Lí** [坤变为离].

Within **Lí**, the **void yin** [虚阴]—
**one yang line above and below, one yin line in the center** [上下各一阳爻，中一阴爻]—
Must be filled by the **true yang of Kàn** [坎中之真阳],
Only then is the **complete Qian essence** [乾体之真] restored.

If one **mistakes the false forms of the body’s heart and kidney** [一身心肾之假象],
And **clings to internal water-fire exchange as truth** [执水火内交为真],
This is **erroneously grasping the meaning of *"acquiring a companion in the southwest"** [西南得朋之义].

It is like the **true-west king** [正西国王],
Who **pledges brotherhood with the complete truth from Zhōunán Mountain** [结拜锺南山祈雨之全真],
Sharing bed and board,
**Seizing the true as false** [假夺其真],
While the **true is lost** [真者反陷].

**Kàn** [坎] is, in Pre-Heaven, the **true west** [本正西];
**Lí** [离] is, in Pre-Heaven, the **true east** [本正东].
The **true spirit of Lí** [离中真灵] resides in the west,
Thus the **true master of Kàn** [坎中之真主]
Is also the **true master of Lí** [离中之真主]—
They must not be **divided** [不得而二视之].

**Kàn** symbolizes a **well** [井].
The **Kàn Hexagram** [坎卦]—
**one yin line above and below, one yang line in the center** [上下各一阴爻，中一阳爻]—
Its **upper and lower lines** [上下二爻] represent the **eight angles of the four directions** [八角四方],
Clear as **jade-like glass** [透如琉璃],
Hence it is said:
*"Eight-cornered glass well"* [八角琉璃井边].
*"Suddenly, ten thousand rays of golden light"* [忽起万道金光]—
This is the **true gold within Kàn** [坎中之一真金].
One can generate ten thousand—
Hence the **ten thousand rays** [有万道].
*"Pushed into the well’s depths,
Covering the well’s mouth,
Transplanting a banana tree above,
Transformed into my likeness,
Seizing the realm and territory."*

This allegorizes those who **mistakenly identify heart and kidney as Kàn-Lí** [谬认心肾为坎离],
**Sealing the tail-end orifice in vain** [空闭尾闾之穴],
While **inverting the true essence** [逆陷其真];
**Usurping the Sovereign’s *Tài* [泰]**
And **stealing its false pretenses** [窃行其假].

「When they speak of *"the City Deity"* [都城隍], *"the Dragon King of the Sea"* [海龙王], *"the Judge of the Eastern Prison"* [东狱阎君], *"the wine gathering"* [会酒], *"kinsmen and friends"* [亲友], *"brothers"* [弟兄], all these phrases depict their alignment with the **yin spirits** [阴神], sharing **qi** [气] in harmony, making clear that all four great elements [四大] within their being belong to **yin** [阴].

This is the discourse of the **Ghost King** [鬼王] paying homage and distinguishing between **evil and righteous** [邪正]. It reveals the **Prince of the Original Palace** [本宫太子], who is the **true yang’s direct lineage** [真阳之嫡脉], the **root of the savior** [救主之根裔]. Yet, he must seek guidance from the place where he was born from his mother [伊母生身之处], tracing the clues to fulfill his mission. If the mother and child are severed [母子隔绝], the child cannot fully express filial devotion or sincere communication [尽孝通诚], nor repay the mother’s kindness nor rescue the father from his predicament [报母恩而拯父难]. This illustrates the loss of **yin-yang’s primal order** [阴阳失其宗位], for how could one’s **true nature** [天性] remain uncorrupted?

*"Leaving behind a white jade* [白玉珪]*"—*
The **bi** [珪] symbolizes **sincerity** [信], and two **earthly elements** [二土] complement each other, signifying the **harmonious union of husband and wife** [夫妻合意同心], not mere outward pretense [外假模样] or inner emptiness [内无实用] that could achieve this. Hence it is said:
*"I shall entrust a dream to the Original Palace,
Instructing them that mother and child should unite in harmony,
So that you, master and disciple, may align in sincerity."*

This entire ghostly tale [鬼话] is but the **divine revelation** [天机].
When **Tripitaka** [三藏] stumbled and awoke in shock [忽绊一跌惊醒], he had just realized the truth within the dream [梦中方觉].
The **Traveler** [行者] declared:
*"Master, dreams arise from thoughts.
A heart filled with dreams, like old disciple’s single true thought,
Is solely to behold the Buddha—
No dream shall ever reach me."*

He spoke of dreams as **illusions of the unenlightened** [蒙昧不真], for the **true person** [真人] knows no dreams. Yet **Tripitaka** is a true person—how then does he dream?

In ancient times, **Xinxie** [心斋] visited **Lord Yangming** [阳明公], and sat as a guest. When asked:
*"If the true person knows no dreams, why did Confucius dream of Master Zhou?"*
**Lord Yangming** replied:
*"This is the very essence of a true dream."* [梦真]
Xinxie heard this in astonishment [愕然], then knelt and bowed, facing north [逐下拜，执北面礼].

The dreams **Tripitaka** experienced came from the **lunar realm** [论月中]. *"Ghost"* [鬼] and *"cloud"* [云] are but the **soul of the moon** [月魂]. This is the **true essence of the lunar dream** [梦月中之真], not a false one. Hence, the Traveler saw within the moonlight a **white jade bi** [白玉珪] indeed, and said:
*"This matter is true."*

Yet many doubt this, unwilling to act decisively. The Traveler took full responsibility, saying:
*"All lies with old disciple.
Just follow my lead, and it shall be done."*

This is the **Buddha’s promise** [佛祖所云]—*"I now guarantee your success,
And this extraordinary affair shall be fulfilled."* [我今为汝保任，成此希有之事]

The brilliance of decisive action lies in **first binding the infant** [先结婴儿].
Why is binding the infant not beyond the **Kàn-Lí* [坎离] *fulfilled* [既济] *Dao/Way* [道]?
He transformed the **red lacquered box** [红金漆匣], placing the **bi** [白玉珪] within—
Two **earthly elements** [二土] in harmony,
This is to summon the infant to witness the **secret teachings** [秘法].

Marvelous indeed!
*"The Great Sage transformed into a two-inch-long novice monk,
Hiding within the box"*—
A **strange transformation** [奇变] into its **complement** [偶], a **great into small** [大变小],
The **primordial and postnatal** [先天后天] have no fixed form—
With or without substance, they are ever-shifting in appearance [无定体，有质无质无常形].
*"This treasure within the box
Can foresee the past and future of one thousand five hundred years."* [能知一千五百年过去未来之事]
Is it not the **refined essence of the three-five* [三五] *cycle* [之精灵] *?* [耶]」

「The name **"Establish the Emperor’s Treasure"** [立帝货] is given,
Capable of founding the great principle of the world,
Yet causing the Emperor to emerge from **Zhèn** [震].
It transmutes the **treasure** [宝贝] into a **true person** [真人]—
Not the **I, Zhou, Huò, or Gé** [伊、周、霍、葛] of old!

The **Great Sage** [大圣] transformed into a **white hare** [白兔儿],
As the **moon’s spirit** [月魂], the **refined essence of true yang within yin** [阴中真阳之精].
Without this essence, one could not **bind the infant** [结婴].
There are **unfathomable yin-yang transformations** [阴阳不测],
Marvels of **divine transcendence and alchemical change** [出神入化之妙],
Thus the **Crown Prince** [太子] shot an arrow at the white hare,
And the **Great Sage** [大圣] dove into the **red box** [红匣].

When **yin moves**, it becomes **yang**;
When **yang stirs**, it turns to **yin**—
This is what is meant by **divine transformation** [神化].

The **Tripitaka Master** [三藏] spoke of **seeking scriptures in the Eastern Lands and offering treasures** [东土求经进宝],
The Crown Prince replied: *"The Eastern Lands are indeed exhausted beyond measure!"* [东土其穷无比。]
Why so? Though **Golden Master** [金公] was born in the East,
He was truly **a parasitic guest of the West** [实寄生于西].
The West is rich, the East is poor—
This is his natural state.
One must **clearly discern** [认得],
To summon him without letting him **drift away to other lands** [流落他乡],
Only then can **mother and child reunite** [母子相见],
And the **child repay the father’s kindness** [子报父恩].

Thus the **Tripitaka Master** [唐僧] said:
*"You have not avenged your father’s wrongs—
In vain you claim to be human!"* [你的父冤未报枉为人！]

The **Disciple** [行者] leapt from the box,
From a **three-foot-tall child** [三尺之童] to full growth,
All in an instant.
Past, present, and future,
Ancient and modern—
All beings, all things are thus.
By understanding the **principle** [理], one knows them all—
Why bother with endless calculations?

But if one can **recognize** [识得] the **lonely one** [称孤者] in the present,
Then **true insight** [真知] into the **ten thousand ages** [千万年] will be **burningly clear** [灼见],
And **fully comprehended without remainder** [已了彻无遗矣].

For the **human form** [人身] arises from the **interaction of Heaven and Earth** [乾坤交感],
Yet the **true father of one’s birth** [生身之真父] has already **fallen into the abyss** [失陷于坎].
The present body is but a **pure yin phantasm** [纯阴之假体].
All mistake it for reality—
They are all in a **dream** [梦中].
The Disciple could not help but **speak plainly and directly** [正色直指]:
*"The one who departed as the wind spirit—
That is your **true father of birth** [生身之老父];
The one now seated—
That is the **fully authentic** [全真] one who **prays for rain** [祈雨]."*

How **sharp and decisive** [斩绝明快]!
Yet alas—
The **bewildered** [迷人] do not believe,
Instead, they **mistake the one presenting the white jade** [白玉珪] *as*
The **deceiver of my treasure** [骗我宝贝之人]!

Beyond the **name** [名], there is another **name** [名];
Beyond the **body** [身], there is another **body** [身].
*"The white hare pierced by the arrow—
That is **Old Monkey** [老孙]."
*
If one recognizes the **white jade rabbit** [白玉珪] and believes in it without doubt,
Then one may **recite** [念] the **enactment of filial gratitude** [养育恩] and **avenge the wrongs done to one’s parents** [替亲报仇].

The **Immortal Master** [仙师] in this passage
Reveals the **Dao/Way’s profound mysteries** [道妙] line by line from the **true parents of one’s birth** [生身父母],
Hence the saying:
*"Ask your **country’s mother, the queen** [国母娘娘] a single word—
See how their **husband-wife affection** [夫妻恩爱] fares!
Just this,
And you shall know the **true from the false** [真假].*
*
This is **whispered counsel** [悄语], **gentle admonition** [低言],
A **secret safeguard of one’s life** [密保性命之事],
Truly **urgent and earnest** [叮咛切嘱]!

**Chapter Thirty-Eight** [第三十八回]
*"The Infant Disciple Questions the Mother, Discerning Right from Wrong"* [婴儿问母知邪正]
*"Gold and Wood Merge with the Mystic, Revealing False from True"* [金木参玄见假真]

**Master Ru Yi** [悟一子] said:
*"The opening verse of this chapter reads:
‘When you meet me, speak only of the **cause of birth** [受生因],
And you will be one who has **attained the assembly of the Thus-Come One** [如来会上人].’
*
It states that if one knows the **source of birth’s cause** [受生因] from whence it comes,
Then one knows the **method of immortality** [不死之方] is also **constructed** [造] therefrom,
Is it not **transcendent and supremely awakened** [超然大觉]?
One who has **attained the assembly of the Thus-Come One** [如来会上人]!

**Confucius** [宣圣] said:
*"How can one know **death** [死] if one does not know **birth** [生]?
Only by knowing **birth** [生] does one then know **death** [死]."*

**Han Yang True Person** [汉阳真人] said:
*"One must take the **corpse** [死尸] as the **living body** [生尸],
Do not **cling to the label of ‘birth’** [生门] and **deny the label of ‘death’** [死门]."*

**Master Cheng** [程子] said:
*"If one can **trace the origins** [原始],
And **understand the principles of birth** [知得生理],
Then one can **grasp the end** [要终],
And **know the principles of death** [知得死理].*
*
All speak of this same **meaning** [义].

The mind, when made pure and still,
Sees the Buddha in the dust of the world—
Ten directions gaze upon the descending **Mighty One**.

This is the **Way** of keeping the heart clean while the body remains in the world;
The Buddha is vast within the dust, not confined to the Western Paradise.

The body, undivided in self and other, reveals the **mysterious principle**—
This **Mighty One** descends from the void, untouched by names and forms.

As the *Avataṃsaka Sūtra* states:
*"Bodhisattvas belong to sentient beings;
Without sentient beings, all bodhisattvas would never attain supreme awakening."*
This is the meaning of the Buddha in the dust, seen by all ten directions.

*"To know the true master of today,
One must inquire of the mother who bore you in years past."*
This speaks of cultivating the **elixir** today, yet to grasp its true mystery,
One must delve into the origin of the mother who gave birth to you,
Only then will the truth be clearly understood.

As the *Awakening to Reality* states:
*"Urge you to seek the source of your birth-body,
Returning to the origin is the **Pharmaceutical King**."*

*"There is another worldly realm unseen by the world,
Each step a new beginning, each stride anew."*
This **teaching**, transmitted outside scripture, is rarely known by the world.
If one knows it and walks this path,
Each step blooms with fresh flowers—
Lotus after lotus unfolds.

As **Zhongyang True Person** said:
*"If you wish to leave secrets in the world,
Few are the true listeners."*

And the **Dan Jing** states:
*"One grain advanced, one grain refined—
Golden lotuses bloom, yet none recognize them."*

The verses here use symbols to reveal meaning—
What matters is transcending symbols to grasp the **meaning**,
And forgetting words to hold the **meaning**.

The tale of the **Princess**’ dream:
*"Remembering half, forgetting half,"*
For husband and wife reuniting are half true, half false—
How much more so in the realm of dream-death?

The forgotten half conceals a hidden meaning,
Only revealed later through the **Pilgrim’s** and **Eight Rules’** exploration of **metal and wood** mysteries,
Where truth and falsehood are discerned.

The **Prince** asks:
*"Mother, how deep was the love between husband and wife in the palace?"*
The **Princess** replies:
*"This matter remains unclear even in the underworld."*

*"Speaking of cold and warmth so starkly distinct,
With emotional ties severed—
One may perceive that true love is the **orthodox (正)**,
While separation is the **heterodox (邪)**.

This is entirely an empty illusion of **husband and wife**,
Yet falsely clings to lineage as a son—
**Suppressing the natural flow of Dao (天机)**,
**Defying the true nature of existence (真性)**—
What is more **heterodox** than this?

If one wishes to **correct the orthodox** and **remove the heterodox**,
They must first make **husband and wife, mother and child** believe in unity—
Only then can the **previous life** be saved,
Preventing its **degeneration and obscurity (沉沦埋没)**.

The **Princess** recognizes **White Jade Tablet (白玉珪)**,
**Unites it with the night’s dream (合诸夜梦)**,
And entrusts her son to **urgently invite the Holy Monk (圣僧)**,
To **discern the orthodox and heterodox (辨明邪正)**,
And repay his **filial virtue (父恩)**.

**Combining one tablet and two soils (总一圭二土)**,
**Uniting meaning and heart (会意联心)**,
From **death**, seeking **life (从死中求活)**—
Within **calamity**, **virtue emerges (害里生恩)**.

As in the *Awakening to Truth Chapter (《悟真篇》)*:
*"If one meets the killing intent and clarifies its reversals (若会杀机明反覆),
Only then does one know that within calamity, virtue arises (始知害里却生恩)."*

But—
*"To seek the Heavenly treasure (欲求天上宝),
One must use worldly wealth (须用世间财)."*

One must first **gather the Dao’s wealth (聚法财)**,
To **assist the practice of the Way (助道用)**.

**Sun Wukong (行者)** gathers a **wild wind of beasts (聚兽阴风)**,
And the **beasts of boundless measure (野兽)** respond in chorus,
With **great blessings (洪福)**,
Singing triumphantly as they return to the city—
This is the meaning.

Yet, those who practice this are as **numerous as cow’s hair (如牛毛)**,
While those who succeed are as **rare as rabbit’s horns (如兔角)**,
All because **truth and falsehood cannot be clearly discerned (真假未能确见)**.

The **discrimination between truth and falsehood (真假之辨)** lies in the distinction between **solitary cultivation (孤修)** and **mutual aid in practice (共济)**:
**Solitary cultivation** is **false** and difficult to fulfill,
While **mutual aid** is **true** and easily achieved.

If one does not **delve deeply with utmost care (精心穷究)**,
Nor **penetrate the profound mysteries (参透玄机)**,
Then they will **mistake the false for true**,
Or **mistake the true for false**—
**Erroneously acting**, they will never see the **true treasure (真宝)**,
How then can they **revive the dead and return to life (起死回生)**,
Or **remove the heterodox and restore the orthodox (除邪返正)**?

Thus, **Sun Wukong (行者)** has a matter in mind,
And **cannot sleep (睡不着)**—
After **consulting with his master (与师父计较)** and devising a plan,
He **delves into profound mysteries (深研几)**,
Revealing the **secret teachings of master and disciple (师徒传道之密旨)**.

**Sun Wukong** arrives at **Hui Gui’s (八戒) bedside** and calls for the **precious item (宝贝)**,
Saying, *"Let’s go steal it together."*
**Hui Gui** replies, *"I’ll go if it’s thievery."*
**Sun Wukong** says, *"Once we obtain the treasure,
I’ll buy it immediately."*
**Hui Gui** says, *"Then give the treasure to you."*
Both are **overjoyed (满心欢喜)**,
And on **clouds of boundless joy (纵祥云)**,
They **directly head to the banyan tree’s base and the well’s edge (径到芭蕉树下井边)**.

This is where **the metal father and wooden mother unite in meaning and heart (金公木母合意同心)**,
**Wood fully merges with metal (全木交并)**,
**Husband leads, wife follows (夫唱妇随)**,
**Plundering the Dao’s profound mysteries (窃天地之玄机)**,
And **stealing the vital breath of life from the killing intent (盗杀中之生气)**.

Those who **cultivate the elixir (修丹志士)**,
If they can **penetrate this profound truth (能于此处参透真妙)**,
Will have **the true treasure to act upon (真宝下手处)**—
As said in *"In the underworld’s gathering, none recognize it,
Only the banyan tree offers late-night contemplation (阎阳会上无人识，只与芭蕉作晚参)."*

**Hui Gui** descends into the well,
And suddenly sees the **Crystal Palace (水晶宫)**,
Asking the **Dragon King (龙王)** for the **precious item (宝贝)**—
This is the **symbol of filling the abyss (坎填离)**.

The **Dragon King** leads **Hui Gui** to the **Black Rooster King’s corpse (乌鸡王尸)**,
Pointing it out as the **precious item (宝贝)**,
And saying, *"**Sun Wukong** has the intention of **reviving the dead and returning life (起死回生)**,
Rely on you—**whatever treasure he seeks, he will obtain (要甚么宝贝都有)**."*

This **illustrates the elixir’s return and the reversal of yin and yang (寓丹道返还之妙，阴阳颠倒之用)**.
If one can **transform the killing intent into life-giving breath (转生杀之机)**,
And **practice it in reverse (逆而修之)**,
Then **calamity turns to fortune (灾中变福)**,
And **within harm, virtue arises (害里生恩)**—
As said: *"**The Five Phases (五行)** in their natural order are **hellish fire pits (法界火坑)**;
**Reversed practice (正行颠倒)** yields **seven treasures of the earth (大地七宝)**."*

**Hui Gui** **touches the corpse with one hand (一把摸着)**,
Yet **refuses to carry it out (不肯驼出)**.
**Sun Wukong** says, *"That is the **precious item (宝贝)**—
Why not carry it up?"*

**Hui Gui** **discerns the single stroke in the abyss (坎中之一画)** as **the essence of death (死质)** and not the **precious item (宝贝)**,
While **Sun Wukong** **discerns the true essence within the abyss (坎中之真主)** as **vital breath of life (生气)** and thus the **precious item (宝贝)**—
This is the **profound mystery of metal and wood in harmony (正金木相参之玄妙)**.

**Hui Gui** carries the **corpse back to the Monastery of Precious Treasures (宝林寺)**,
And says, *"My elder brother told me—
He can **revive the dead and return life (救得活)**."*

Was **Sun Wukong** truly **without intent (无意)**,
Yet **mocking him to take revenge (捉弄他报仇)**?

**The Great Sage (大圣)** has the intention of **reviving the dead and returning life**,
And the **Dragon King** had already spoken of it—
It is merely **borrowing Hui Gui’s actions (借八戒)** to **point out that the world truly has such elixirs (指世间实有起死回生之药)**,
Urging them to **seek it urgently (宜急早寻求)**.

If the **dead can be revived (死者尚可生)**,
Why fear that the **living cannot transcend mortality (生者不可仙)**?
This is **implicitly stated (隐然言表)**.

Ah! (吁！)"

The **imperial cap and robes** cannot halt decay—
Emperors and tyrants alike turn to dust.

If one does not refine the **Golden Elixir (金丹)**,
One’s life is but a ghost’s hollow abode.

---
**Chapter Thirty-Nine**
*A Single Grain of Elixir Obtained from Heaven*
*Three Years Later, the Old Master Revives in the World*

**Treasured Son** said: *"Zhuangyang True Person declared:*
*'Swallowing a single grain of elixir into the belly,*
*Only then does one know one’s life was originally from Heaven.'*
This speaks of the elixir being obtained from the **Yang world (阳世间)**,*
That life is self-made, not granted by Heaven.*

Yet the outline states *'obtained from Heaven (天上得)'*—
Is this not too distant, raising doubts in people’s minds?

But when it speaks of *'Heaven (天上)'*, it means **Heaven within humanity (人中之天)**,*
Not Heaven above (天上之天).

**Hui Gui** said, *"Master, do not believe him.*
He originally said one need not pass through the **Underworld (阴司)**—
In the **Yang world (阳世间)**, a physician can revive him."*

**The Great Sage** said, *"Let the Old Monkey try it in the Yang world."*
*"I shall now seek the **Venerable Laozi (太上老君)***
To beg for a grain of **Nine-Turn Reincarnation Elixir (九转还魂丹)**—
I shall certainly revive him!"*

For **Laozi’s wondrous Dao** exists within the **Yang world**,
And can be attained by all who seek it earnestly—
It is not in Heaven above, only waiting for those who find it.

**Lu Zu** said:
*"I hear people say they all seek me,*
*Yet they tread the world’s edges—no one truly finds me!"*

The **Immortal’s heart to save the world** surpasses that of mortals seeking salvation.
Yet mortals lack the **virtue and devotion** to receive salvation,
Refusing to **sincerely believe and hold firm in their hearts**,
Rejecting transformation, passing by **face-to-face with the True Ones**—
How can one force them to accept salvation?
All must await death before it is too late.

Speaking of this, one can only weep deeply!

**Hui Gui** guards the corpse and weeps—
*Is this the sorrow of **Bian Que’s lament (卞璞)**?*
*Or the pity of **Chu Fu’s grief (楚覆)**?*
*Or the mourning of **Chu Lin’s despair (锄麟)**?*
*Or the lament of **the collapsing city (崩城)**?*
*Or the wail of **Changsha’s grief (长沙)**?*

*Man’s life not yet ended, yet his heart already lost—*
*Oh, Heaven!*
Within a single cry, **yellow paths and black roads** intertwine,
Encompassing boundless suffering in the world’s salvation!

When the sorrow reaches its peak, those who hear shall surely weep—
How much more shall the **Elder’s heart ache with tears!**

**The Great Sage** arrives at **Li Hentian (离恨天)**, **Duosuo Palace (兜率宫)**.
**Laozi** instructs: *"The boys who guard the elixir,*
*Be cautious—thieves come to steal again!"*

When **The Great Sage** borrows the elixir and refuses to give it,
He turns to leave, but **Laozi** chases after him.
For the **Golden Elixir** is a **stolen treasure of transformation**—
Its presence or absence depends not on **Laozi’s stinginess**.
Fearful of theft, he must give it,
Yet giving it is the same as stealing—
The thief’s cunning is beyond all mortals’ sight or knowledge.

**The Great Sage** calls, *"Sha Monk, fetch water."*
**Hu Po** stirs the mixture in her voice.

He spits out the **Golden Elixir** into the corpse’s belly.
**Tripitaka** says, *"If one gains a human’s breath of life, it will suffice."*
**The Great Sage** exhales a **"huff"** of pure **qi** into the throat—
*"A loud sound—then the king’s **qi gathered, his spirit returned**."*

For the **Returning Elixir** has no form—
Without a breath of pure **qi**, it remains unseen.
*"Qi gathered, spirit returned"*—
This is when **metal returns to its original nature (金来归性初)**,
Only then can it be called **Returning Elixir**,
And the old king returns to his kingdom.

The **Water-Clothed Emperor** emerges from the **Kan Palace (坎宫)**—
Many are astonished, so **The Great Sage** clarifies:
*"This is the **Black Cock King (乌鸡国王)**, your true master!"*
He instructs the king to don **Daoist robes**,
Willing to ascend to the **Western Heaven**—
Yet why does **The Great Sage** then say,
*"You need not go to the Western Heaven—
You shall remain your emperor!"*

For a ruler who attains the **Dao in office** can
Practice the **Way of Yao and Shun (尧舜之道)**,
Transform the world, accumulate **virtue and deeds**,
Passing them to future ages,
Saving countless lost souls eternally—
This surpasses **Wei Fu’s merit and deeds a thousandfold**—
Why seek the **Western Heaven** again?

This passage’s poem reveals what *Awakening to Reality (悟真)* did not,
And transmits what the **scriptures** did not—
Yet readers dismiss it as idle chatter,
Equating **Heaven’s secrets and sacred instructions** with vulgar speech,
For they lack true guidance from a true master.

As the opening line states:
*"In the West, the secret is found—seek the True One."*
If one has not obtained the secret,
Even if a true treasure is before them,
How can they truly perceive it?

Next:
*"Metal and water harmonized—now refine the spirit."*
**Metal (金)** is the **Public (公)**, **Wood (木)** is the **Mother (母)**—
Their union forms the **elixir’s head**—
This is the shared meaning across countless scriptures.

If one has not obtained the secret,
They may mistakenly take *"harmonized"* as **alchemical union with a woman (闺丹御女之术)**,
Falling into heresy—
How then can they attain **Suchness (真如)**?

*"The elixir’s mother bears only confused dreams,"*
Meaning the **Ghost King’s dream**—
Half of it is not truly remembered.

Yet the elixir truly has a **Mother**,
And the Mother truly bears **confusion**—
Yet she conceals this mystery from her.

As it says:
*"The infant forever laments his parasitic body,"*
Meaning the **Quanzhen sect’s usurpation**—
The **Crown Prince** is the **parasite**,
Illustrating that the **Great Dao** has an **infant**—
Yet it is not empty.

Yet the infant truly has no form,
And the infant truly has a **parasitic body**—
This is the elixir’s profound mystery.

As it states:
*"One must seek the original master at the well’s bottom,"*
Meaning **Hui Gui’s descent into the well** and return with the **Ghost King**—
Illustrating **filling the **Kan (坎)** with **Li (离)**.*

Yet the **original master at the well’s bottom** has no form—
And the original master truly has a form—
Only those who seek shall find it.
And only by seeking through others can the elixir be perfected.

As it says:
*"One must also pay homage to Laozi in Heaven,"*
Meaning **The Great Sage’s** borrowing of the **Returning Elixir** from **Laozi**—
This implies that **elixir refinement must follow Laozi’s teachings.**

「Yet the **Laozi** is not in the **Heaven of Heaven (天之天)**, but in the **Heaven of Man (人之天)**.
*"Still one must pay homage"*—
This means bowing in reverence and returning,
Seeking from the **Heavens (天)**, then one may obtain the elixir.

It concludes with:
*"Awakening to the emptiness of form and returning to one’s true nature,*
*Truly the **Buddha** saves those with karmic ties.*
Meaning, after attaining the elixir,
One may perceive the nature and illuminate the mind,
Realizing **form is emptiness**, emptiness is form,
Returning to one’s original nature as void,
Then the **Buddha** may save those with karmic ties—
Seeing the **Buddha** is the **Immortal Sage**, the **Immortal Sage** is the **Buddha**.

Those with a predestined **Immortal Sage** connection,
Who can penetrate this verse,
The **alchemical elixir’s** profound secrets are complete—
Even **shelves of sacred scriptures** are no longer needed.

The **Master and Disciple** summon the **King’s** deposition,
The **Demon King** vanishes at the sight of the sky—
All recognize their **former master**,
For *"the true essence now resides in the Yellow Gold Hall (黄金室),*
*a single spark of wisdom forever departs not"*—
This is so.

The **liberation** comes not from the **Underworld (阴司), the Heavens (天), future lives (来生), or other realms (异世),**
But from one’s own **self (本身)** and the **manifest world (阳世)**.

In the following text, the **Demon King** is defeated—
If he were to **transform his guise** and still appear as the **King’s** form,
Would one not be unable to distinguish him?

Yet how does he change to resemble **San Zang (三藏)**,
So that the **Tight-Fitting Spell (紧箍咒)** can reveal him?

The **Immortal Sage** speaks metaphorically of the **original master’s** true and false nature being fixed,
Yet the **Master’s** transmitted secrets may vary.

If one encounters two **Masters**,
And cannot discern who is true and who is false,
Unable to distinguish and mistakenly takes the wrong one as genuine—
This would harm the true one.

Thus, the **verification** of the **living principle (活儿)** must be precise—
Only then is it the **true secret transmission**;
If one **blusters without verification**, it is false teaching.

**Sun Wukong** leaps higher,
Seeking **elevated insight** and **direct contact** with the **true principle**.

**Manjusri** holds the **Mirror of Demon Illumination (照妖镜)**,
Fixing the **Green Lion’s** demonic form—
*"By the **Buddha’s** decree, to avenge the grudge of the water calamity,"*
Meaning those who have suffered harm all mistakenly recognize their own **karmic sins (孽)** as fabricated.

*"This is a castrated lion—*
*It cannot defile purity."*
This refers to those who practice **solitude in the **Dharma of Emptiness (空门)****.

The **lion** is the **Master**.
The **Green Lion** is the **pretender Master**—
A **false Master** masquerading as the **true Master**,
How demonic! How tragic!

Yet in this world, there are many **castrated lions**—
How I wish **Manjusri Bodhisattva** would swiftly bring the **Mirror of Demon Illumination** to seize and remove them!

The **Mirror of Demon Illumination** is the **discriminative wisdom** that perceives others.

**The Forty-First Chapter: The Infant’s Play Disturbs the Zen Mind**
**The Monkey’s and Horse’s Knives Clash with the Wooden Mother’s Void**

**The Sage’s Disciple** says:
These three verses together reveal that,
After attaining the elixir,
One must fully perceive the nature and illuminate the mind,
Ascend to **highest clarity (上彻)** and descend to **lowest tranquility (下梧)**,
Sweep away the **six desires (六欲)**,
Practice **meditation, insight, and wisdom (禅定慧)**,
Face the wall in **non-action (无为)**,
And approach **transformation into the divine (神化)**.

First, it recounts **Sun Wukong** calling the **Daoist** to don his original attire,
Holding the **white jade staff (白玉珪)**,
Ascending the hall to proclaim himself **sovereign**—
This is the **Great Concealment (大隐)** not hindering residence in the court,
As the **wind stirs the world (风动天下)**,
And blessings extend to all people.

Then he declares:
*"I still act as my own **monk (和尚)**,
And go to cultivate **meritorious deeds (功德)**."*

This means that **laymen who attain the elixir (韦布之士)**,
If **greed, anger, and delusion (贪、嗔、痴)** remain unchecked,
And their **practices and virtues (功行)** are incomplete—
This is **cultivating life, not nature (修命不修性)**,
Also a **stubborn Immortal Sage** stuck in **deluded paths (滞迹)**,
Hard to transcend the **Three Realms (三界)**.

As the **Song of the Divine Elixir (敲爻歌)** states:
*"Only cultivating the **Master’s** nature, not the elixir,*
*The endless kalpas turn in vain—one never enters the **Sage’s** path.*
*Clinging to the **Dharma of Life (命宗)**,*
*Lost in the **Master’s** nature—*
*Like a mirror without reflection,*
*One’s face has no fixed image.*
*Lifespan equal to Heaven and Earth,*
*A foolish man with no mastery,*
*Yet holds wealth like a thief without true ownership."*

The **Immortal Sage** intentionally unleashes the **evil fire (邪火)** of **Hong Haier (红孩儿)** and the **filthy water (孽水)** of **Hei Shui Niao (黑水鼍)**,
To teach one to awaken to **true understanding**.

**Huiyan Sage**’s poem says:
*"There is a thing that precedes Heaven and Earth,*
*Formless, originally still and boundless.*
*It can be the master of all phenomena,*
*Yet does not wither with the four seasons."*

The **Dharma of Life (命)** is the **true nature (性)**.
**Nature** has **good, none evil**,
Yet the **mind** cannot be without **partiality and completeness**—
This is the **post-heavenal qi’s** purity and turbidity.

Thus, to **fulfill nature (尽性)**, nothing surpasses **dying to the mind (死心)**;
**Dying to the mind** means **dying to the mind that harms nature**.
To **die to the mind**, nothing surpasses **forgetting the contrivances (忘机)**;
**Forgetting contrivances** means **forgetting what disturbs the mind**.
To **forget contrivances**, nothing surpasses **nurturing qi (养气)**;
**Nurturing qi** means **nurturing the qi that moves the mind**.

**Hong Haier (红孩儿)** is the **innocent child’s heart**.
The **heart** is the **fire repository (火藏)**,
With **yang quality** and **yin nature**,
Externally bright, internally dark.
When **flame ascends (炎上)**, anger surges to the heavens;
When **first ignited (始燃)**, the **latent contrivance (伏机)** lies within.

*"Gathering fire-qi, it soars straight to the ninth sky,"*
This is **anger**.
*"Naked body, no clothing, dangling from the tree’s tip,"*
This is the **latent contrivance**.
Its **sudden rise and fall, ever-changing and unpredictable**,
Holds the **deceitful mind (昧心)** that plays with **true principle (正)**,
Desiring to **overthrow the enlightened wisdom (明眼)** that guards the **true principle**—
This is the **true contrivance**.

The phrase *"wasting one’s mental efforts"* is the **demon’s** confession.

The three **disciples** each grasp their weapons,
As if ready to strike—
The **Elder** rages at the **monkey’s** demonic tricks,
And in fury **seizes the horse** to scold.

All **portray** the **stimulated mind** in **anger**,
Disturbing the **Zen mind**.

*"Gully of the withered tree,"*
Wood dried, fire **flares**—
Tracing the **mind-demon’s** origin where its power thrives.
*"Red in hundreds of thousands,"*
Fire **intensifies**, color **burns bright**—
Describing the **mind-demon’s** rampant might.

Feigning **suffering from calamity and capture** to seek rescue,
And falsely claiming **lands, kinfolk** to offer **bribes**—
All are **exaggerations** of the **mind-demon’s** ever-shifting **deceitful schemes**.

**Bajie** wields the **staff of precepts (戒刀)** and cuts the **rope** to free the **demon**,
Unable to **perceive the mind** and thus **break precepts** to **free the mind**.

The **Elder** commands the **child** to **ride the horse** and take it away,
Yet **has not subdued nature** and thus **reluctantly allows the horse to follow its nature**.

*"Do not let the two monks carry it,"*
*"I am glad to carry it myself,"*
The **fire-demon** laughs and **recklessly subdues the gold**.

*"Only three catties in weight,"*
*"This frame is so light,"*
The **gold-demon** is **manifest yet secretly harbors fire**,
A **confused yet enlightened** state where **evil and true principle** persist through time.

The ancient poem thus states:
*"When Dao and virtue tower high, the demonic miasma rises high,
For the mind’s essence is inherently still—yet from stillness arises malevolence.
The Mind-Lord walks upright in the Middle Way,
Yet the Wood-Mother, dull and misguided, strays beyond and falls into chaos.

The Thought-Bird speaks not yet harbors amorous cravings,
The Yellow-Crone utters no words yet frets with anxious heat.
When rogue thoughts gain sway, they bring only fleeting joy,
For in the end, they dissolve from the very place where virtue was rooted.*

It speaks of how when the Middle Way is disturbed by agitation,
One cannot remain steadfast—thus stillness breeds malevolence.
The Mind-Lord is inherently upright,
Yet when fire stirs, the Wood-Mother falters—unable to grasp true principle, that is *"straying beyond and falling into chaos."*
Like the pulse of the Yin and Yang, the two chaotic paths,
Not guided by the Middle Way.

When lost, the Thought-Bird no longer obeys the Mind-Lord,
And amorous cravings arise—when cravings stir, the steadfast virtue is disordered,
Bringing upon itself anxious heat.

Only when rogue thoughts are rooted out from the place of virtue
Can one attain true stillness—stillness within movement,
Movement within stillness—like the steadfast virtue itself.
Then rogue thoughts have no power to run rampant.
This poem elucidates the core principle of the outline: *"Monkey-Horse-Staff-Gui-Wood-Mother-Empty."*
It is the true peril of a disordered mind.

When the mind is disordered, unable to remain steadfast,
The Monkey’s and Horse’s gold and water,
The Staff’s and Gui’s two soils,
The Wood-Mother’s wood and fire,
All lose their true nature and become empty—
That is the meaning: *"Where fire arises from wood, disaster will certainly strike."*

*"The Great Sage’s heart brims with resentment,"*
Steadfast virtue disrupted by movement;
*"That demon’s heart ignites with fury, stirring a whirlwind, hurling sand and stone,"*
Movement without steadfast virtue.

The Master’s traces vanish—
The mind is obscured, and nature falls into confusion.

The Pilgrim and Bajie confer, each parting their ways—
The mind is disordered, and the Five Phases become empty.

Sha Wujing says:
*"It has a beginning but no end."*
It means one can cultivate the vital breath (命) but not the nature (性).

Yet those who can truly begin and end are entirely reliant on the Thought-Soil (意土).
When the Thought-Soil is sincere, the Mind-Lord stands upright,
And delusion can be dispelled.
Sha Wujing is the Thought-Soil.
Thus the Pilgrim says:
*"Since the virtuous younger brother has such sincere resolve,
We shall still go in search of that demon,
To rescue the Master."*

The Great Sage’s heart burns with true anguish—
The Thought-Soil is sincere, and the Mind-Lord stands upright.

*"Transforming into three heads and six arms,"*
Three of Heaven’s, six of Earth’s—
Realigning the cosmos, fixing the upper and lower positions—
Steadfast virtue.

*"Strike eastward one path, strike westward another path,
And strike forth a band of impoverished gods."*
Ah!

Ah, wondrous indeed!

For truly, sincere intent must first attain knowledge—
to fail in attaining knowledge while striving for sincerity is folly, not sincerity.
How then could one clarify the heart and perceive the nature?

Thus the virtuous seeker values profound inquiry into subtle changes,
exhausting the divine to fathom transformations,
so as to exhaust their variations.

*"Strip one layer, hang one layer,
Pants without a crotch, trousers without a mouth."*
The utmost exhaustion—
to illuminate exhaustion by probing its essence,
and to exhaust its transformations utterly.

*"Six hundred *jie* drills piercing the mountain,
Encompassing thirty mountain deities,
Thirty earthly deities."*
Speaking of the Earth’s circular expanse,
vast and broad, six hundred *jie* in measure.

This is as the *Parameters of the Mysterious Unity* says:
*"Six-five, the receptive bearing,
Binding the beginning and end,"*
*"Sixty folds gathered on one axle."*
For the Earth thrice generates fire,
capable of piercing upward with fiery heat—
the *Li* hexagram’s symbol of clarity and dissolution.

When it follows Heaven’s bestowal,
it harmonizes its nature and nurtures all things;
When the Earth’s fire is excessive,
it distorts its nature and scorches all living beings.

The deities lament:
*"They grind our heads smooth,
leaving no incense, no paper—
no blood offerings at all.
They demolish our shrines,
strip our robes,
and leave us no peace."*

What harm is this but the rampant fury of fire’s nature?
Like a greedy official’s tyrannical blaze—
cruel and oppressive—
he plunders the people’s sustenance,
strips the earth bare.
Their hearts and their harm are one and the same.

*"Gutted-tree ravine, cloud-cave flames"*—
this describes the scorching inferno,
wooden fire raging, its smoke blinding the sky.

They speak of their parents—
the Bull Demon and the Rakshasa,
originally demonic,
refined in the Fire Mountain’s *sanmei* practice—
a perverse *sanmei*,
the extreme of evil,
not the true, upright *sanmei* of enlightenment.
They are called *"Holy Infant King"*—
infant yet self-sacred,
infant yet self-enthroned,
infant yet self-augmented—
merely ignorance incarnate.

Truly, *"Before refinement, the infant’s demon-fire prevails,"*
urgently requiring *"the Monkey-Heart and Wooden-Mother to uphold it."*
How terrifying, how perilous!
